CA2254.shortDescription: Template should be a static expression
CA2254.fullDescription: The logging message template should not vary between calls.

CS8602.shortDescription: Dereference of a possibly null reference.

CS8618.shortDescription: Non-nullable field must contain a non-null value when exiting constructor. Consider declaring as nullable.

S112.shortDescription: General or reserved exceptions should never be thrown
S112.fullDescription: This rule raises an issue when a general or reserved exception is thrown.

S125.shortDescription: Sections of code should not be commented out
S125.fullDescription: Commented-out code distracts the focus from the actual executed code. It creates a noise that increases maintenance code. And because it is never executed, it quickly becomes out of date and invalid.

S1481.shortDescription: Unused local variables should be removed
S1481.fullDescription: An unused local variable is a variable that has been declared but is not used anywhere in the block of code where it is defined. It is dead code, contributing to unnecessary complexity and leading to confusion when reading the code. Therefore, it should be removed from your code to maintain clarity and efficiency.

S2583.shortDescription: Conditionally executed code should be reachable
S2583.fullDescription: Conditional expressions which are always true or false can lead to unreachable code.

S2589.shortDescription: Boolean expressions should not be gratuitous
S2589.fullDescription: Gratuitous boolean expressions are conditions that do not change the evaluation of a program. This issue can indicate logical errors and affect the correctness of an application, as well as its maintainability.

S6602.shortDescription: "Find" method should be used instead of the "FirstOrDefault" extension
S6602.fullDescription: Both the List.Find method and IEnumerable.FirstOrDefault method can be used to find the first element that satisfies a given condition in a collection. However, List.Find can be faster than IEnumerable.FirstOrDefault for List objects. For small collections, the performance difference may be minor, but for large collections, it can make a noticeable difference. The same applies for ImmutableList and arrays too.

S6605.shortDescription: Collection-specific "Exists" method should be used instead of the "Any" extension
S6605.fullDescription: Both the List.Exists method and IEnumerable.Any method can be used to find the first element that satisfies a predicate in a collection. However, List.Exists can be faster than IEnumerable.Any for List objects, as well as requires significantly less memory. For small collections, the performance difference may be negligible, but for large collections, it can be noticeable. The same applies to ImmutableList and arrays too.

S927.shortDescription: Parameter names should match base declaration and other partial definitions
S927.fullDescription: Parameters are part of the method signature and its identity.
